DOC.brief_title: Childhood Sexual Abuse , Vaginismus Labor Dystocia
DOC.detailed_description: Previous study indicate childhood sexual abuse long term implication woman 's psychological physical well-being ; among , depression , plethora gynecological symptom labor dystocia . Literature field also suggest childhood sexual abuse may contribute factor total and/or partial vaginismus : psycho-sexual disorder associate significant difficulty pain attempted penetration , pelvic examination and/or sexual relation . The propose quantitative longitudinal study aim develop theoretical model explicate relationship : childhood sexual abuse , prenatal postpartum partial vaginismus , childbirth ( labor dystocia versus labor dystocia ) ; include association depression mediate variable . Questionnaire responses pregnant woman ( Hebrew/Arabic speaker ) Hillel-Yaffe medical center Israel include study . Data collection extend across three time period : prenatal ( third trimester pregnancy ) , within one month postpartum , approximately six month postpartum . Study questionnaires probe participant 's socio-demographic gynecological history , traumatic life event , sexual experience , level depression , partial vaginismus sexual distress objective subjective severity childbirth experience . Simulations project carry help set statistical significance goal determine sample size need achieve goal . From simulation , sample size N=2000 determine adequate cost effective , determine standard deviation SD ( define confidence interval Â±SD ) 0.022 correlation . The potential significance study twofold : Theoretically , study represent first kind effort explore relationship child sexual abuse , prenatal postpartum partial vaginismus , childbirth depression , single comprehensive longitudinal research study . Practically , study may potentially assist wide range health care professional : 1. provide develop theory evidence-based practice . 2. show need integration woman 's past history prenatal postnatal care mean lower risk traumatic birth experience later psychological distress . 3. aid development intervention model treatment woman history child sexual abuse and/or vaginismus pregnancy childbirth .
